_pdb_ions.name: _pdb_ions
_pdb_ions.description: Ions recognized by the PDB (e.g. Na⁺, K⁺, Ca²⁺, Zn²⁺, …).
_pdb_ions.definition: resname AL BA CA CD CL CO CS CU CU1 CUA HG IN IOD K MG MN MN3 NA PB PT RB TB TL WO4 YB ZN

_charmm_ions.name: _charmm_ions
_charmm_ions.description: Additional ion names from CHARMM force fields.
_charmm_ions.definition: resname CAL CES CLA POT SOD ZN2

protein.name: protein
protein.description: All standard and non-standard amino acids (must have a CA atom).

dna.name: dna
dna.definition: resname DA DC DG DT DU

rna.name: rna
rna.definition: resname A C G U T

water.name: water
description: Crystallographic & MD water molecules
**PDB‐recognized**:
- `HOH <https://www.rcsb.org/ligand/HOH>`_ , `DOD <https://www.rcsb.org/ligand/DOD>`_
**MD force-field types**:
- WAT, TIP3, H2O, OH2, TIP, TIP2, TIP4
_Note_: HH0, OHH, and SOL are omitted due to naming conflicts.
water.definition: resname HOH DOD WAT TIP3 H2O OH2 TIP TIP2 TIP4

aminoacid.name: aminoacid
aminoacid.description: A residue with atoms named C, N, CA, and O
aminoacid.definition: (same residue as name C) and (same residue as name N) and (same residue as name CA) and (same residue as name O)

vmd_nucleic.name: vmd_nucleic
vmd_nucleic.description: A residue with atoms named C, N, CA, and O
vmd_nucleic.definition: (same residue as name P) and (same residue as name O1P) and (same residue as name O2P) and (((same residue as name "C3'") and (same residue as name "C4'") and (same residue as name "C5'") and (same residue as name "O3'") and (same residue as name "O5'")) or ((same residue as name "C3*") and (same residue as name "C4*") and (same residue as name "C5*") and (same residue as name "O3*") and (same residue as name "O5*")))

lipid.name: lipid
lipid.description: Common lipid residue names from PDB and CHARMM.
lipid.definition: resname GPE LPP OLA SDS STE DLPE DMPC LPPC OLEO PALM PCGL POPC POPE

glycan.name: glycan
glycan.definition: resname NAG BGLN FUC AFUC MAN AMAN BMA BMAN

drude.name: drude
drude.description: Drude oscillator atom types (LP or DRUD).

solvent.name: solvent
solvent.description: Anything other than protein, sugar, nucleic or lipid.
solvent.definition: not (protein or sugar or nucleic or lipid)

aromatic.name: aromatic
aromatic.description: Aromatic amino acids: HIS, PHE, TRP, TYR.

aliphatic.name: aliphatic
aliphatic.description: Aliphatic amino acids: ALA, GLY, ILE, LEU, VAL.
aliphatic.definition: resname ALA GLY ILE LEU VAL

hydrophobic.name: hydrophobic
hydrophobic.description: Hydrophobic amino acids: ALA, LEU, VAL, ILE, PRO, PHE, MET, TRP.
hydrophobic.definition: resname ALA LEU VAL ILE PRO PHE MET TRP

basic.name: basic
basic.description: Basic amino acids: ARG, HIS, LYS, HSP.

neutral.name: neutral
neutral.description: Neutral residues: VAL, PHE, GLN, TYR, HIS, CYS, MET, TRP, ASX, GLX, PCA, HYP.
neutral.definition: resname VAL PHE GLN TYR HIS CYS MET TRP ASX GLX PCA HYP

acyclic.name: acyclic
acyclic.description: Protein residues that are not cyclic.

cyclic.name: cyclic
cyclic.description: Cyclic amino acids: HIS, PHE, PRO, TRP, TYR.
cyclic.definition: resname HIS PHE PRO TRP TYR

purine.name: purine
purine.description: Purine nucleobases: DA, A, DG, G, ADE, GUA.
purine.definition: resname DA A DG G ADE GUA

pyrimidine.name: pyrimidine
pyrimidine.description: Pyrimidine nucleobases: DC, C, DT, T, DU, U, CYT, THY, URI.
pyrimidine.definition: resname DC C DT T DU U CYT THY URI

cg.name: cg
cg.description: Cytosine and guanine bases: DC, C, DG, G.

ta.name: ta
ta.description: Thymine/adenine bases: DT, T, DU, U, DA, A.
ta.definition: resname DT T DU U DA A

buried.name: buried
description: Residues that are tipically buried in the protein core
Includes: ALA, CYS, ILE, LEU, MET, PHE, TRP, VAL
buried.definition: resname ALA CYS ILE LEU MET PHE TRP VAL

surface.name: surface
description: Residues that are tipically exposed on the protein surface
Includes: ARG, ASN, ASP, GLN, GLU, GLY, HIS, LYS, PRO, SER, THR, TYR
surface.definition: resname ARG ASN ASP GLN GLU GLY HIS LYS PRO SER THR TYR

small.name: small
description: Residues defined for the 'small' flag in ProDy
Automatically extracted from `prody.flags.DEFAULTS['small']`.
Residues: ALA, GLY, SER

medium.name: medium
description: Residues defined for the 'medium' flag in ProDy
Automatically extracted from `prody.flags.DEFAULTS['medium']`.
Residues: ASN, ASP, CYS, PRO, THR, VAL, ASX, PCA, HYP
medium.definition: resname ASN ASP CYS PRO THR VAL ASX PCA HYP

large.name: large
description: Residues defined for the 'large' flag in ProDy
Automatically extracted from `prody.flags.DEFAULTS['large']`.
Residues: ARG, GLN, GLU, HIS, ILE, LEU, LYS, MET, PHE, TRP, TYR
large.definition: resname ARG GLN GLU HIS ILE LEU LYS MET PHE TRP TYR

backbone.name: backbone
description: Residues defined for the 'backbone' flag in ProDy
Automatically extracted from `prody.flags.DEFAULTS['backbone']`.
Residues: C, CA, N, O
backbone.definition: (protein and name C CA N O) or (nucleic and name P O1P O2P "C3'" "C4'" "C5'" "O3'" "O5'" "C3*" "C4*" "C5*" "O3*" "O5*")

backbonefull.name: backbonefull
description: Residues defined for the 'backbonefull' flag in ProDy
Automatically extracted from `prody.flags.DEFAULTS['backbonefull']`.
Atoms: C, CA, H, H1, H2, H3, N, O, OXT
backbonefull.definition: (protein and name C CA H H1 H2 H3 N O OXT)

calpha.name: calpha
description: Ca atoms of :term:`protein` residues, same as selection
``'name CA and protein'``

sidechain.name: sidechain
description: side-chain atoms of protein residues
Same as: 'protein and not backbonefull'

helix.name: helix
description: All helix types as defined by DSSP/STRIDE: alpha, 3-10, and pi helix.
Equivalent to: 'structure H G I'

sheet.name: sheet
description: All beta sheet types as defined by DSSP/STRIDE: extended and bridge.
Equivalent to: 'structure E B'

coil.name: coil
description: All non-helix, non-sheet secondary structure: coil, turn, bend, and unassigned.
Equivalent to: 'structure C S T' (DSSP) or 'structure C T' (STRIDE)

alpha_helix.name: alpha_helix
description: Alpha helix as defined by DSSP/STRIDE.
Equivalent to: 'structure H'

pi_helix.name: pi_helix
description: Pi helix as defined by DSSP/STRIDE.
Equivalent to: 'structure I'

helix_3_10.name: helix_3_10
description: 3-10 helix as defined by DSSP/STRIDE.
Equivalent to: 'structure G'

extended_beta.name: extended_beta
description: Extended beta strand as defined by DSSP/STRIDE.
Equivalent to: 'structure E'

bridge_beta.name: bridge_beta
description: Beta bridge as defined by DSSP/STRIDE.
Equivalent to: 'structure B'

turn.name: turn
description: Turn as defined by DSSP/STRIDE (hydrogen-bonded turn).
Equivalent to: 'structure T'

bend.name: bend
description: Bend as defined by DSSP (geometry-based, not in STRIDE).
Equivalent to: 'structure S'

stdaa.name: stdaa
stdaa.description: The twenty standard amino acid residue names.
stdaa.definition: resname ALA ARG ASN ASP CYS GLN GLU GLY HIS ILE LEU LYS MET PHE PRO SER THR TRP TYR VAL

nonstdaa.name: nonstdaa
nonstdaa.description: Common non-standard amino acid residue names.
nonstdaa.definition: resname ASX GLX CSO CYX HIP HID HIE HSD HSE HSP MSE CME SEC SEP TPO PTR PHD XLE XAA MEN CSB

nucleobase.name: nucleobase
nucleobase.short: A, G, C, T, U bases
nucleobase.description: Purine and pyrimidine nucleobases (adenine, guanine, cytosine, thymine, uracil).
nucleobase.definition: resname ADE GUN CYT THY URA

nucleotide.name: nucleotide
nucleotide.description: Mono- and deoxy-nucleotides (A, C, G, T, U variants).
nucleotide.definition: resname DA DC DG DT DU A C G T U

nucleoside.name: nucleoside
nucleoside.description: All recognized nucleosides and their phosphate derivatives.
nucleoside.definition: resname ADN AMP ADP ATP AGS CMP A2P A3P CTN C2P C3P C5P CDP CTP GMP 5GP GDP GTP THM TMP TPP TTP URI UMP UDP UTP

prody_protein.name: prody_protein
prody_protein.description: All standard and non-standard amino acids (must have a CA atom).
